info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 11:55PM CDT until June 14 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR WESTERN GARLAND...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND WEST CENTRAL HOT SPRING COUNTIES... At 1155 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Meyers, or 16 miles east of Mount Ida, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Mountain Pine... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Bonnerdale... Crystal Springs Landing... Sunshine... Royal... Lena Landing Rec Area... Silver... Pettyview... Hempwallace... Pearcy... Crystal Springs... Hurricane Grove... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
